**Astro** (Korean:Â ì•„ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¡œ; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]

After their web drama finished airing, the group started the "Meet U" project. As part of the project, Astro traveled through South Korea, covering songs in front of crowds and holding fan meetings. Along with the performances, a KakaoTalk Plus Friends account was set up. Fantagio stated that once the group had gathered 10,000 friends on the app, they would announce their official debut date.[9] The goal was met by December 2015.[10] Their debut showcase, held on January 28, 2016, was sold out in under a minute and far exceeded the original limit of 1,000 attendants.[11][12] There, they also announced their official fan club name, Aroha.


They also appeared in their own reality TV show titled *Astro OK! Ready*, which began airing on January 21, 2016, on MBC every1[13] and concluded on February 18, 2016.[14]



### 2016: Debut with *Spring Up* and rising popularity[edit]

Originally scheduled for March 13,[105] Astro held their annual fan meeting Astro Aroha Festival to commemorate their sixth anniversary on April 9, this time titled 2022 Astro Aroha Festival [Gate 6]. The event was held both online and in person, making it their first fan meeting with a live audience since 2019, prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.[106] During the fan meeting, MJ announced that he would enlist in the military as part of his mandatory military service on May 9, making him the first Astro member to serve.

**Astro** (Korean:Â ì•„ìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¡œ; stylized in all caps) is a South Korean boy band formed by Fantagio.[1] The group is composed of four members: MJ, Jinjin, Cha Eun-woo, and Yoon San-ha.[2] Originally a six-piece group, Rocky departed from the group on February 28, 2023,[3] and Moonbin died on April 19, 2023.[4] They debuted on February 23, 2016, with the extended play *Spring Up* and were subsequently named as one of the best new K-pop acts of 2016 by *Billboard*.[5]




## Career[edit]


</fragment>

**Lee Dong-min** (Korean:Â ì´ë™ë¯¼; born March 30, 1997), known professionally as **Cha Eun-woo** (ì°¨ì€ìš°), is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy band Astro.




## Early life[edit]


Cha Eun-woo was born on March 30, 1997 in the city of Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province.[2][3][4] He attended Suri Middle School and Suri High School before graduating from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2016.[5] He studied at Sungkyunkwan University, majoring in performing arts in the theater department.[6]



## Career[edit]


### 2013â€“2015: Career beginnings[edit]


Cha debuted as an actor in 2014 with a minor role in the film *My Brilliant Life*.[7] He was the fourth trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. In August 2015, Cha, along with the other members of Astro, participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[8]



### 2016â€“present: Debut with Astro, solo activities and rising popularity[edit]

<fragment>
![](image)Cha for *Marie Claire Korea* in 2020
Astro debuted on February 23, 2016, with the EP *Spring Up*. In August, Cha participated in the Chuseok special variety show, *Replies That Make Us Flutter*.[9] In September, he participated in another Chuseok pilot program, *Boomshakalaka*.[10]


Cha was announced as a host of *Show! Music Core* alongside Kim Sae-ron, Lee Soo-min and Xiyeon from 2016 to 2018.[11] In 2016, he also starred in the web drama *My Romantic Some Recipe*.[12]


In 2017, Cha was cast in the KBS2 drama *Hit the Top*[13] and starred in the web drama *Sweet Revenge*.[14]


In 2018, Cha starred in the web drama *Top Management*.[15] He was later cast in the JTBC romantic comedy series *Gangnam Beauty*, his first leading role on television.[16][17] He saw a rise in popularity after the series aired[18][19] and was included in GQ Korea's "Men of the Year".[20]

<title>Cha Eun-woo</title>
<fragment>

**Lee Dong-min** (Korean:Â ì´ë™ë¯¼; born March 30, 1997), known professionally as **Cha Eun-woo** (ì°¨ì€ìš°), is a South Korean singer and actor under the label Fantagio. He is a member of the South Korean boy band Astro.




## Early life[edit]


Cha Eun-woo was born on March 30, 1997 in the city of Gunpo, Gyeonggi Province.[2][3][4] He attended Suri Middle School and Suri High School before graduating from Hanlim Multi Art School in 2016.[5] He studied at Sungkyunkwan University, majoring in performing arts in the theater department.[6]



## Career[edit]


### 2013â€“2015: Career beginnings[edit]


Cha debuted as an actor in 2014 with a minor role in the film *My Brilliant Life*.[7] He was the fourth trainee to be officially introduced with the Fantagio iTeen Photo Test Cut. In August 2015, Cha, along with the other members of Astro, participated in the web-drama *To Be Continued*.[8]



### 2016â€“present: Debut with Astro, solo activities and rising popularity[edit]


See also: Astro (South Korean band)


</fragment>
<fragment>

In November 2018, Cha was included as one of GQ Korea's Men of the Year.[20] In 2019, he ranked seventhâ€”with 44,178,474 pointsâ€”in the Most Accumulated Points On Male Idol Brand Reputation.[78][*unreliable source?*] In the K-pop Radar Year-End Chart of 2019, Cha was named as the male "Hot Instagrammer".[79]


In April 2021, Cha placed 17th on *Forbes* Korea Power Celebrity and sixth in the SNS category.[80] In April 2022, after Cha was selected to represent contemporary men's clothing brand Liberclassy,[55] traffic to the company's mall increased by 806% in the first week of April from the previous week, and the brand also saw an increase in social media engagement.[81] An official from Liberclassy said, "The Cha Eunwoo effect was seen as more than 70 million won in sales generated for pre-application alone".[82]

Astro debuted on February 23, 2016, with the EP *Spring Up*. In August, Cha participated in the Chuseok special variety show, *Replies That Make Us Flutter*.[9] In September, he participated in another Chuseok pilot program, *Boomshakalaka*.[10]


Cha was announced as a host of *Show! Music Core* alongside Kim Sae-ron, Lee Soo-min and Xiyeon from 2016 to 2018.[11] In 2016, he also starred in the web drama *My Romantic Some Recipe*.[12]


In 2017, Cha was cast in the KBS2 drama *Hit the Top*[13] and starred in the web drama *Sweet Revenge*.[14]


In 2018, Cha starred in the web drama *Top Management*.[15] He was later cast in the JTBC romantic comedy series *Gangnam Beauty*, his first leading role on television.[16][17] He saw a rise in popularity after the series aired[18][19] and was included in GQ Korea's "Men of the Year".[20]

### Music video appearances[edit]

<fragment>

In 2019, Cha starred in the historical drama *Rookie Historian Goo Hae-ryung* alongside Shin Se-kyung.[21] He played the role of an royal prince who became a romance novelist, and won the Excellence Award for an Actor and Best Couple Award with Shin at the MBC Drama Awards.[22] In December, he was announced as a cast member of the new variety show *Handsome Tigers* alongside Joy, Lee Sang-yoon, Yoo Seon-ho, and Seo Jang-hoon.[23]


In April 2020, Cha joined SBS television show *Master in the House* as a fixed cast member.[24] At the 2020 SBS Entertainment Awards, he won the Rookie Award for his role on the show.[25] In December 2020, he starred in the tvN coming-of-age romance drama *True Beauty* based on the webtoon of the same name, playing a high school student alongside Moon Ga-young.[26][27]
